meanings.sent1: Her hyperbolic reaction to the news made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement's hyperbolic claims about the product's benefits were misleading.
meanings.sent3: His hyperbolic storytelling always entertained us at family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The hyperbolic praise for the new movie made it seem like a must-watch.
meanings.sent5: The hyperbolic description of the storm made it sound terrifying.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a hyperbola
meanings.sent1: The hyperbolic curve fascinated the students in math class.
meanings.sent2: The architect used hyperbolic shapes in the design of the building.
meanings.sent3: The hyperbolic nature of the graph confused the students at first.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had a hyperbolic structure that mirrored a hyperbola.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting featured hyperbolic lines inspired by hyperbolas.

meanings.sent1: The hyperbolic language used in the advertisement caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: His hyperbolic storytelling style made his anecdotes more engaging.
meanings.sent3: The hyperbolic praise for the dessert made it irresistible to try.
meanings.sent4: The hyperbolic claims in the article made it hard to distinguish fact from fiction.
meanings.sent5: The hyperbolic nature of his compliments made her blush.
